intro: Gaulettia racemosa, commonly known as the redroot sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are fern-like and finely divided, while its flowers are small and white to pink in color. Gaulettia racemosa is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
